topic: How to implement web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Implementing Web Backends using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide will provide a brief overview of how to create and implement web backends using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs with Python.
It provides an intuitive syntax that allows for easy and efficient API creation.
FastAPI supports features such as type hints, automatic documentation generation, and asynchronous handling out of the box.
Python 3.12+ is required to take full advantage of FastAPI's latest enhancements.
version_notes: FastAPI version 0.71.0 is compatible with Python 3.12.
It is recommended to regularly check the FastAPI GitHub page for updates and potential compatibility changes.
caveats: Although FastAPI supports Python 3.12, it may not take full advantage of any new features in that version unless explicitly utilized.
It's important to ensure that any dependencies have compatible versions when working with the latest Python release.
